yelp_reviews.author: A M.
yelp_reviews.review: Went to college up here and made the mistake of living here. They are a scam. If you want your security deposit back, don't count on it. They lie and blame others for something they screwed up. For example: they would say my roommate was lying to me about parking, rent, etc., to get out of the fact that they acted without reason. Seriously WATCH OUT. Luckily as men, we were able to fix stuff on our own, but I know their maintenance man, Daniel, is useless when helping my friends who were other tenants. They are nice to your face, but it's a SCAM. Other tenants are actually taking them to COURT to get their deposits back.  THEY ARE NOT WORTH THE HEADACHE. FIND SOMEWHERE ELSE.

yelp_reviews.author: Mark B.
yelp_reviews.review: To reiterate what the other reviewer said, these people are crooks!  My daughter rented and apartment for two years and we have been fighting to get the security deposit returned.  We left the place in excellent condition and they made up damages to justify retaining 88% of the $800 deposit.  We took them to small claims court and won.  Now they're trying to stiff us on the amount of the original deposit refund.  Unscrupulous, lying, cheating, low down dirty SOB of an owner!  Don't reward this piece of work by renting one of his apartments!

google_reviews.author: maddy white
google_reviews.review:
I really love the new management. It seems as though they really care about making sure issues are taken care of in a timely manner. The new property managers are the main reason why my roommates and I resigned our lease for next year.

It also seems like they are starting to renovate parts of the buildings. We just got new railings for the stairs and balconies and they look great and feel so much safer.

ownerResponse.text: Hello Maddy - thank you for the review! We're glad to see that you are choosing to stay another year.

google_reviews.author: R H
google_reviews.review:
It took weeks/months for maintenance to fix requests which still were done wrong. There has been on and off construction for a year, the water was shut off randomly because they hit a line, then they boarded off the back doors in each unit so you weren't allowed to use your own porch for a month. They raise rent for their units every year. I got no less than a hundred mass texts about parking while I lived here from management.

UPDATE: the manager took 90% of the entire deposit siting cleaning fees and maintenance for 8 hours worth of work yet the unit was deep cleaned before even leaving which was noted by the manager. The manager then didn't respond to emails asking why they took 1000 dollars and gave back 50. The on-site manager was rude and unhelpful. There are newer and nicer places, I recommend those.

google_reviews.author: Willow Roark
google_reviews.review:
I lived there for a 2 years. It wasn't horrible but there were a lot of issues.
Pros: There's a gorgeous trail right next to it that leads right to the interurban system, the high school, and Joe's Garden. There's always bunnies and birds around. Sometimes there was noise from music, but not a lot at all. They gave decent notice for entrances. They allow pets with a fee: it was around 200-300 dollars. Hot water in our unit lasts a surprisingly long time. It's a ~16 minute walk from campus through the beautiful arboretum. There's bus stops around a 4 minute walk away.
Cons: I was never offered a tour of the apartment. The washing machines are often out of service, and only some units have in-unit laundry (highly recommend finding one of those). The dishwasher is inefficient and often leaves food on our plates left to wash. Our hot water heater exploded and flooded our apartment one night. The whole complex is aging and the rent is far higher than it's worth. I believe this used to be primarily a family complex so one room in our two bedroom is much larger than the other. Hagen, the nearby grocery outlet, is not an affordable. The parking is very limited and you need to have guests park a block away. The baseboard heating is inefficient and costs a lot on the energy bill. The bathroom's amenities were aged and our shower ceramic had chips in it. Not secure: we were robbed while we were there. Mildew is almost impossible to prevent and becomes a health hazard. The parking lot has a lot of vertical inclines and is very hard to navigate: folks with mobility related disabilities be advised. No in-unit AC, which becomes a problem as the PNW gets hotter.

google_reviews.author: Jordyn Michelle
google_reviews.review: Not fancy by any means. You can tell management and handymen care, but youre still paying an arm and a leg for four walls and a toilet. Also, dont be surprised if you find bugs if you live in the bottom floor

ownerResponse.text: Hello Jordyn - thank you for the kind words for management and maintenance. If you have any issues that you think management can resolve, please do not hesitate to reach out to the on-site office.

google_reviews.author: Gage Hall
google_reviews.review: My Maintenance was scheduled on my time and the handyman, Steve, was extremely kind and outgoing, he made a quick an easy job fixing my bathroom shower head and sink stopper.

ownerResponse.text: Thank you Gage for the review
Hello Cole - it sounds like there's something we could have done to better accommodate you. Please reach out to the on-site office and let the manager know how we could have done better. Thank you!

summary.text:
Good

The Pomeroy Court Apartments have been noted by some residents for having a dedicated management team. Newer reviews highlight the new management’s commitment to addressing issues expediently, a change which has proven instrumental in tenants' decisions to renew their leases. These reviews suggest that management under the new direction is attentive, setting a positive contrast to some past experiences.

Residents have mentioned renovations and improvements, indicating the property is undergoing updates which enhance safety and aesthetics, including the installation of new railings. Such improvements contribute to an overall good impression which is further affirmed by the property's responsiveness to some online reviews, creating a sense of attentiveness and community involvement.

Great

When examining the great aspects of Pomeroy Court Apartments, one finds commendations for the physical surroundings and handyman services. The proximity to local trails, the presence of wildlife, and nearby amenities offer a connection to nature and convenience. Additionally, maintenance staff like Steve have received kudos for their kind demeanor and efficiency in resolving issues, bringing a personalized touch to the tenant experience.

The location itself is also a source of satisfaction, with reviews naming the area around Pomeroy Court Apartments as notably pleasant. Such sentiment showcases the potential for a high quality of life within this apartment community when operations function smoothly and residents feel their homes are well-maintained.

Bad

On the downside, the Pomeroy Court Apartments have received their share of unfavorable criticism, particularly regarding maintenance concerns. Residents have reported frustrations with the handling of their maintenance requests, stating that issues can take excessively long to address or are resolved improperly. This raises concerns about the effectiveness of the apartment's maintenance operations and impacts the overall living experience negatively.

Further denoting the bad aspects, some residents feel that the rent increases do not align with the quality of the apartments, citing aging infrastructure and inadequate in-unit amenities. Inefficiencies such as problematic dishwashers and laundry facilities have been pointed out as pain points, suggesting that there is room for the property management to make more consistent updates and improve the functional quality of the apartments.

Ugly

The ugliest issues cited in user reviews encompass the severe disputes concerning security deposit returns. Tenants have accused the property management of being deceitful, claiming that managers concoct damages as a pretext to withhold substantial portions of the security deposits. Such allegations have apparently led to legal action, with tenants taking the company to court to reclaim their money.

Allegations of unresponsiveness and poor communication further stain Pomeroy Court Apartments' reputation, with instances of management allegedly not addressing queries regarding deducted deposits. These issues, combined with accounts of disrespectful conduct by on-site managers, paint a worrying picture, suggesting a potential pattern of mismanagement and failure to maintain transparent, ethical relations with tenants.
